children.subject: I’m taking it right now and it’s a good amount of work. This class opens many doors in the field of computer science. There’s CS upperdivs that require this class and if you want to take classes like 186, 161 or 162 and more you should probably take 61c. But, if you’re not really serious about CS and you are more on the data science side of things, then you can get by fine without 61C. At the high level this class breaks down the steps in which a computer processes code. It’s harder to get help with bugs and its higher workload than 61b. I recommend you do it, it’ll benefit you if you ever become a SWE.

<md>Have you done CS 70? That's a pretty fundamental class and arguably more important than 61C if your focus is data science, since CS 70 opens the door to a lot of probability and stats classes</md>

history.content:
I'm a data science major so I don't have to take 61C, but after taking 61B, the material in 61C seems pretty interesting to me. I am wondering how useful/relevant 61C is for real-world software engineering and whether if it would be worth the time to take it. Is it as time-consuming as people say? How's the workload compared to 61B? 

Also, what other CS classes past 61B would you recommend? I don't really HAVE to take any CS class in particular.
history.subject: Should I take CS61C & Course Suggestions
